title: Nancy Stair: A Novel
author: Lane, Elinor Macartney
snippet: Although the trouble seemed to pass by in this happy fashion, I had so little faith in his Grace of Borthwicke that, the morning for which I knew the duel had been set, I rose early and rode by the Old Bridge Road to see if anything concerning it were on foot.

title: An editor's retrospect;
author: Cooper, Charles Alfred
snippet: One day a certain Dr. Pritchard, a man of venerable appearance, was accused of abducting a girl from her parents. He had taken her to a coffee-house on the Westminster Bridge Road, and there she was found. He was sent to the Surrey Sessions for trial, and he was convicted.
